metadata.title: CVE-2023-25012 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - low
metadata.description:
The Linux kernel through 6.1.9 has a Use-After-Free in bigben_remove indrivers/hid/hid-bigbenff.c via a crafted USB device because the LEDcontrollers remain registered for too long.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-25012` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 6.2.0-18.18
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 6.2.0-18.18
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 6.2.0-1004.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1004.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-18.18').
linux-aws package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
linux-azure package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1003.3').
linux-gcp package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1005.5').
linux-ibm: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was pending').
linux-lowlatency package in mantic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1002.2').
linux-oracle package in mantic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication.
linux-raspi package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-1004.5').
